summary: This document is an email chain from August 10, 2019, regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. It includes a forwarded Bureau of Prisons statement announcing Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell from an apparent suicide and later pronounced dead. The email also references the Attorney General expressing 'serious concerns' and ordering an investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: Found unresponsive in his cell at MCC New York from an apparent suicide; was under pretrial status for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York (USANYS)
persons.context: Forwarded the Bureau of Prisons statement about Epstein's death to FBI contacts.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit at approximately 6:30 a.m. from an apparent suicide. Life-saving measures were initiated, he was transported to a local hospital, and was subsequently pronounced dead.

events.title: Epstein's arrival at MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein arrived at the Metropolitan Correctional Center under pretrial status after being indicted for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York, NY
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at MCC New York on August 10, 2019, at approximately 6:30 a.m. from an apparent suicide.
Epstein was transported to a local hospital and pronounced dead; the FBI is investigating the incident.
Epstein had arrived at MCC New York on July 6, 2019, under pretrial status for charges of sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.
The Attorney General expressed 'serious concerns' about the incident and instructed the Inspector General to investigate.
The email chain shows coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office (Geoffrey Berman) and the FBI regarding the public statement on Epstein's death.
